definitions.definition: not giving enough attention and thought to what you are doing, so that you make mistakes
definitions.sensetop: it is careless of somebody to do somethingit is careless to do somethingcareless of somebodycareless with somethingcareless about somethingcareless about doing something

examples.text: It was careless of me to leave the door open.
examples.contextForm: it is careless of somebody to do something

examples.text: It would be careless to ignore the risks.
examples.contextForm: it is careless to do something

examples.text: Losing my phone again was very careless of me.
Don't be so careless about spelling.
People have become increasingly careless about revealing personal information online.
She had begun to grow careless.
Try not to be so careless in the future.

definitions.definition: resulting from a lack of attention and thought
not at all worried about something

examples.text: He seemed careless of his own safety.

wordOrigin: Old English carlēas ‘free from care’ (see care, -less).
